p: Despite scientists’ criticisms that such rhetorical use of a deadline is misleading,5,6,7 the shorthand ‘we have only 12 years’ instantly became a common catchphrase among activists, and it was widely circulated in news reports and on social media (Boykoff and Pearman 2019; Bounegru et al. 2020). The widespread use of the 2030 deadline is also evidenced by the fact that prominent public figures, such as US congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez8 and former US State Secretary John Kerry,9 made use of this rhetoric too. The 2030 deadline thus serves as a ‘marker of urgency’ signifying the need for radical mitigation in the present before it becomes ‘too late’ to stop dangerous climate change.
